com.xilinx.rapidwright.debug

Class DesignInstrumentor

  • Object
    • com.xilinx.rapidwright.debug.DesignInstrumentor

  • public class DesignInstrumentor
extends Object
    This class serves as the main entry point for the BYU/Xilinx debug instrumentation flow within RapidWright. Created on: Nov 30, 2015

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      static String DEBUG_CORE_PATH 
      static String SAMPLE_DEPTH_KEYWORD

    • Constructor Detail

      • DesignInstrumentor

    • Method Detail

      • loadInstrumentationDetailsFile

        public void loadInstrumentationDetailsFile(String fileName)
        This should load the instrumentation file details into class members. The file will likely be small, so the function is written for ease of implementation, not speed.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of the instrumentation details file.

      • stitchProbesOnILA

        public void stitchProbesOnILA(ModuleInst mi,
                              EDIFCellInst debugCore)
        Stitches in the debug unit probes and clock into the user design. Specifically, it add the input pin ports of the debug block onto the user design nets of interest.

      • stitchDebugHubToILA

        public void stitchDebugHubToILA(ModuleInst ilaCorePhysical,
                                EDIFCellInst ilaCoreLogical,
                                ModuleInst dhCorePhysical,
                                EDIFCellInst dhCoreLogical)

      • instrumentDesign

        public void instrumentDesign()
        Meat of the instrumentation process. This function will: (1) Choose which pre-compiled block to load based on requested parameters (2) Load the blocks(2) (3) Stitch blocks into user design (4) Place blocks in empty locations within user design (5) Route updated nets

      • createLTX

        public void createLTX(String name)
        Uses list of signals marked for debug to produce debug netlist (.ltx) file for debugging.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        This is the main entry point for Vivado design debug instrumentation.
        Parameters:
        args - There are 3 arguments to this function: (0) Name of the file containing instrumentation details (1) Name of the XPN file for the design (2) Name of the EDIF file for the design The program, under normal operation will output two file names separated by a space These are the instrumented XPN and EDIF files respectively.
